alert.note: Alert for Coconino; Navajo (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 11 at 5:37PM MST until August 11 at 11:30PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: The National Weather Service in Flagstaff has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for Dinnebito Wash... Coconino County in north central Arizona... Navajo County in north central Arizona... * Until 1130 PM MST /1230 AM MDT/. * At 534 PM MST /634 PM MDT/, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain over Dinnebito Wash near Hotevilla. Between 1 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Hopi Reservation and Navajo Reservation. This includes State Route 264 between mile markers 350 and 352...and between mile markers 357 and 367. This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Dinnebito Wash. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. In hilly or mountainous terrain, there are many low water crossings which will become dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
